title: New Releases and More for May 22, 2018
description:
This week, Liberty, Rebecca, Amanda, and Jenn discuss Anger is a Gift, MEM, and more great books. And answer listener questions!
This episode was sponsored by Campaign Widows by Aimee Agresti and Furyborn by Claire Legrand.
Subscribe to All the Books! using RSS or iTunes and never miss a beat book.
Sign up for the weekly New Books! newsletter for even more new book news.
This content contains affiliate links. When you buy through these links, we may earn an affiliate commission.
For a complete list of books discussed in this episode, visit our website.

Books discussed on the show:
Anger is a Gift by Mark Oshiro
The Ensemble by Aja Gabel
Little Fish by Casey Plett
MEM by Bethany C. Morrow
Speak by Laurie Halse Anderson
The Hunger Games by Suzanne Collins
Holes by Louis Sachar
Phoebe and Her Unicorn by Dana Simpson
Tiny Beautiful Things by Cheryl Strayed
Men Explain Things to Me by Rebecca Solnit
Eloquent Rage: A Black Feminist Discovers Her Superpower by Brittney Cooper
The Giant’s House by Elizabeth McCracken
Ninefox Gambit by Yoon Ha Lee
One Good Earl Deserves A Lover by Sarah MacLean
The Sparrow by Mary Doria Russell

What we’re reading this week:
Not That Bad: Dispatches from Rape Culture edited by Roxane Gay
Calypso by David Sedaris
Armistice by Lara Elena Donnelly
Singled Out: How Two Million Women Survived without Men After the First World War by Virginia Nicholson
The Wicked King by Holly Black
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
